title: The Community Garden Mystery
intro:
You arrive at Riverside Community Center for your Saturday volunteer shift at the community garden. The morning air is crisp, and you can see your breath as you walk toward the tool shed. Ms. Rodriguez, the garden coordinator, usually meets volunteers here at 9 AM sharp, but today the area seems unusually quiet.

As you approach the main garden beds, you notice something strange. Several of the newly planted tomato seedlings that were thriving yesterday now appear wilted and brown. The soil around them looks disturbed, with small holes scattered throughout the bed. You hear footsteps behind you and turn to see Kai and Zara, two other regular volunteers, walking up the gravel path with confused expressions.

checkpoints.prompt:
Kai points to the damaged plants and says, "This wasn't like this yesterday when we left." Zara kneels down near one of the holes and examines it closely. "Look at these marks in the dirt," she says. "Something definitely dug here." You notice a small garden spade lying near the compost bin that wasn't there before, and you can see fresh dirt clinging to its blade.

The three of you exchange glances, clearly puzzled by what might have happened overnight.

choices.text: Pick up the spade and examine it for more clues
Ask Kai and Zara what they think might have caused this
Look around the garden for other signs of disturbance

checkpoints.prompt:
Before you can investigate further, you hear the sound of the community center's back door opening. Ms. Rodriguez emerges, carrying her usual clipboard and a steaming coffee mug. She walks briskly toward your group, but stops short when she sees the damaged garden bed.

"Oh my," she says, setting down her mug on a nearby bench. "I was hoping I wouldn't find this." Kai asks what she means, and Ms. Rodriguez sighs. "I got a call from the night security guard around midnight. He said he saw some unusual activity in the garden area, but by the time he came to check, everything seemed normal."

choices.text: Ask Ms. Rodriguez what kind of activity the guard saw
Suggest checking if any tools or supplies are missing

checkpoints.prompt:
Ms. Rodriguez explains that the security guard mentioned seeing small moving shadows near the garden beds, but assumed it was just cats or other animals. As she speaks, you notice movement in the nearby bushes that border the garden. A rustling sound draws everyone's attention to a patch of overgrown shrubs near the fence.

Zara whispers, "There's definitely something in there." You can see the branches moving, even though there's no wind. Ms. Rodriguez takes a step closer to the bushes, her clipboard held protectively in front of her.

choices.text: Walk over to the bushes to see what's causing the movement
Stay back and call out to whatever might be in the bushes
Wait quietly to see if anything emerges on its own

ending: A small brown rabbit hops out from the bushes, followed by two smaller ones. Ms. Rodriguez laughs and shakes her head. "Well, that explains the holes and the damaged seedlings," she says. "Looks like we have some new neighbors who discovered our garden." The rabbits pause for a moment, then bound away toward the far end of the community center property. Kai suggests building a small fence around the vegetable beds, and Ms. Rodriguez nods, making notes on her clipboard. The morning volunteer work begins with a new project to plan.
